question_text: Why might a mobile device use Wi-Fi instead of a cellular network for voice communication?
answer_options: Wi-Fi uses more power and improves performance
Wi-Fi always provides faster speeds than 5G
Wi-Fi is often more stable in areas with poor cellular coverage
Cellular networks are limited to video data only
correct_answer: Wi-Fi is often more stable in areas with poor cellular coverage
explanation: Wi-Fi calling allows voice communication over a wireless network when cellular signal is weak or unavailable.
